name: Melanie Matchett Wood
expertise: Number theory, arithmetic statistics, arithmetic geometry, probability theory
personal bio: Melanie Matchett Wood is a Professor of Mathematics at Harvard University whose research focuses on number theory and arithmetic statistics. A former member of the U.S. International Mathematical Olympiad team, she has held faculty positions at UC Berkeley, the University of Wisconsin, and Stanford University. Her work bridges arithmetic geometry with probability theory to address deep problems in number theory.
list_of_publications: Gauss composition over an arbitrary base
On the probabilities of local behaviors in abelian field extensions
P-orderings: a metric viewpoint and the non-existence of simultaneous orderings

name: Lauren K. Williams
expertise: Cluster algebras, tropical geometry, algebraic combinatorics, amplituhedra, positive Grassmannian
personal bio: Lauren K. Williams is the Dwight Parker Robinson Professor of Mathematics at Harvard University. A Harvard alumna with a PhD from MIT, her pioneering work in algebraic combinatorics and tropical geometry has led to major advances in our understanding of cluster algebras and the positive Grassmannian.
list_of_publications: Enumeration of totally positive Grassmann cells
Positivity for cluster algebras from surfaces
KP solitons, total positivity, and cluster algebras
KP solitons and total positivity of the Grassmannian

name: Laura DeMarco
expertise: Dynamical systems, complex dynamics, arithmetic dynamics, potential theory
personal bio: Laura DeMarco is a Professor of Mathematics at Harvard University whose research explores the interplay between dynamical systems and complex analysis, with a particular focus on arithmetic dynamics. Her innovative contributions to the field have been recognized with prestigious awards including the Ruth Lyttle Satter Prize and election to the National Academy of Sciences.

name: Alison Miller
expertise: Mathematics research and advocacy for gender equity in mathematics
personal bio: Alison Miller is a postdoctoral fellow in the Harvard Mathematics Department. Actively engaged in initiatives to promote gender equity in the mathematical sciences, she participates in panels and discussions aimed at addressing challenges and fostering a supportive environment for women in mathematics.
